question: Nasolacrimal duct opens in-
exp: Ans. is 'a' i. e., Inferior Nasal Meatus Part of lateral nasal wall. Openings. Inferior. Nasolacrimal duct. Middle. Frontal sinus, Maxillary sinus, Anterior ethmoidal sinus. Superior. Posterior ethmoidal sinus. Sphenoethmoidal recess. Sphenoid sinus
topic_name: Anatomy and Physiology of Nose and PNS

question: Location of the nasolacrimal duct:
exp: Ans: (a) Inferior meatues. Ref: Dhingra's ENT 6th ed./ 187-88
topic_name: Anatomy and Physiology of Nose and PNS

question: Nasolacrimal duct opens in w hich part of internal nose?
exp: Ans. is 'b' i. e., Inferior meatus. Part of lateral nasal wall. Openings. Inferior. Nasolacrimal duet. Middle. Frontal sinus, Maxillary sinus, Anterior ethmoidal sinus. Superior. Posterior ethmoidal sinus. Sphenoethmoidal recess. Sphenoid sinus
topic_name: Anatomy and Physiology of Nose and PNS

question: Which of the following is not a function of nose?
exp: ANSWER: (B) Air pressure control. REF: Dhingra 4th ed page 133. Functions of the nose are classified as: 1. Respiration2. Air conditioning of inspired aira. Filtration and purificationb. Temperature control of the inspired airc. Humidification. Protection of lower airway. Mucociliary mechanism. Secretion of Enzymes and immunoglobulins. Sneezing. Vocal resonance. Nasal reflex functions: Smell of a palatable food cause reflex secretion of saliva and gastric juice. Irritation of nasal mucosa causes sneezing. Olfaction
topic_name: Anatomy and Physiology of Nose and PNS

question: The sphenoethmoidal recess has opening of -
exp: Ans. is 'd' i. e., Sphenoid sinus Part of lateral nasal wall. Openings. Inferior. Nasolacrimal duct. Middle. Frontal sinus, Maxillary sinus, Anterior ethmoidal sinus. Superior. Posterior ethmoidal sinus. Sphenoethmoidal recess. Sphenoid sinus
topic_name: Anatomy and Physiology of Nose and PNS
